        // JS for interactive elements would go here
        document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
            // Tab functionality for workout days
            const dayButtons = document.querySelectorAll('[class*="grid-cols-7"] button');
            dayButtons.forEach(button => {
                button.addEventListener('click', function() {
                    dayButtons.forEach(btn => btn.classList.remove('day-active'));
                    this.classList.add('day-active');
                    // Here you would load the workout for the selected day
                });
            });
            
            // Demo video functionality
            const demoButtons = document.querySelectorAll('.exercise-card button');
            demoButtons.forEach(button => {
                button.addEventListener('click', function() {
                    const exerciseName = this.closest('.exercise-card').querySelector('h4').textContent;
                    document.querySelector('#workout-video img').alt = `Detailed demonstration of ${exerciseName} showing proper form and technique`;
                    // Here you would load the appropriate video
                });
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

```

        function showExerciseDemo(button) {
            const exercise = button.closest('.exercise-card').querySelector('h4').textContent;
            document.getElementById('workout-video').querySelector('img').alt = `${exercise} demonstration`;
            // In a real implementation, we'd load the appropriate video here
            alert(`Loading demo for: ${exercise}`);
        }

        document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
            // Tab functionality for workout days
            const dayButtons = document.querySelectorAll('[class*="grid-cols-7"] button');
            dayButtons.forEach(button => {
                button.addEventListener('click', function() {
                    dayButtons.forEach(btn => btn.classList.remove('day-active'));
                    this.classList.add('day-active');
                    // Here you would load the workout for the selected day
                });
            });
            
            // Demo video functionality
            const demoButtons = document.querySelectorAll('.exercise-card button');
            demoButtons.forEach(button => {
                button.addEventListener('click', function() {
                    const exerciseName = this.closest('.exercise-card').querySelector('h4').textContent;
                    document.querySelector('#workout-video img').alt = `Detailed demonstration of ${exerciseName} showing proper form and technique`;
                    // Here you would load the appropriate video
                });
            });
        });
    </script>

### YOU
for the official launch is there any free way to launch it ?
### BLACKBOX.AI

Yes, there are several free options to launch your website! Here are a few popular platforms where you can host your GymRat Companion website for free:

1. **GitHub Pages**:
   - **How to Use**:
     1. Create a GitHub account if you don't have one.
     2. Create a new repository and name it (e.g., `gymrat-companion`).
     3. Upload your HTML file (e.g., `index.html`) to the repository.
     4. Go to the repository settings, scroll down to the "GitHub Pages" section, and select the main branch as the source.
     5. Your site will be available at `https://<your-username>.github.io/<repository-name>/`.

2. **Netlify**:
   - **How to Use**:
     1. Sign up for a free account on Netlify.
     2. Drag and drop your HTML file (and any other assets) into the Netlify dashboard.
     3. Netlify will provide you with a live URL for your site.
     4. You can also connect a custom domain if you have one.

3. **Vercel**:
   - **How to Use**:
     1. Sign up for a free account on Vercel.
     2. Import your project from GitHub or upload your files directly.
     3. Vercel will automatically deploy your site and provide you with a live URL.
     4. You can also set up a custom domain.

4. **Surge**:
   - **How to Use**:
     1. Install Surge CLI by running `npm install --global surge` in your terminal.
     2. Navigate to your project folder in the terminal.
     3. Run `surge` and follow the prompts to deploy your site.
     4. Surge will provide you with a live URL.

5. **Firebase Hosting**:
   - **How to Use**:
     1. Install the Firebase CLI by running `npm install -g firebase-tools`.
     2. Run `firebase login` to log in to your Google account.
     3. Create a new Firebase project in the Firebase console.
     4. Run `firebase init` in your project folder and select "Hosting."
     5. Follow the prompts to deploy your site with `firebase deploy`.

### Steps to Launch:
1. Choose one of the platforms above.
2. Follow the instructions to upload your HTML file and any assets (CSS, images, etc.).
3. Once deployed, you will receive a URL where your site is live.

### Custom Domain:
If you want a custom domain (like `gymratcompanion.com`), you can purchase one from a domain registrar (like Namecheap or GoDaddy) and link it to your hosting platform.

If you need help with any specific platform, feel free to ask!

        // JS for interactive elements would go here
        function showExerciseDemo(button) {
            const exercise = button.closest('.exercise-card').querySelector('h4').textContent;
            document.getElementById('workout-video').querySelector('img').alt = `${exercise} demonstration`;
            // In a real implementation, we'd load the appropriate video here

        }

        document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
            // Tab functionality for workout days
            const dayButtons = document.querySelectorAll('[class*="grid-cols-7"] button');
            dayButtons.forEach(button => {
                button.addEventListener('click', function() {
                    dayButtons.forEach(btn => btn.classList.remove('day-active'));
                    this.classList.add('day-active');
                    // Here you would load the workout for the selected day
                });
            });
            
            // Demo video functionality

                    const exerciseName = this.closest('.exercise-card').querySelector('h4').textContent;

                    // Here you would load the appropriate video
                });
            });
        });

Now, follow these steps to deploy:

1. In your GitHub repository:
   - Click "Add file" > "Create new file"
   - Name the file `index.html`
   - Paste your entire HTML code (from the editor above)
   - Click "Commit new file"

2. Go to Repository Settings > Pages:
   - Under "Source", select "Deploy from a branch"
   - Choose "main" branch and root folder
   - Click Save

3. Wait a few minutes for GitHub to deploy your site. You'll get a notification when it's done.

4. Your site will be live at:
   `https://yourusername.github.io/gymrat-companion/`

For a more professional URL (without github.io), you can:
1. Buy a custom domain (like gymratcompanion.com) from Namecheap or Google Domains (~$10/year)
2. Follow GitHub's guide to connect your domain

    <script>
        // JS for interactive elements would go here
        function showExerciseDemo(button) {
            const exercise = button.closest('.exercise-card').querySelector('h4').textContent;
            document.getElementById('workout-video').querySelector('img').alt = `${exercise} demonstration`;
            // In a real implementation, we'd load the appropriate video here
            alert(`Loading demo for: ${exercise}`);
        }

        document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
            // Tab functionality for workout days
            const dayButtons = document.querySelectorAll('[class*="grid-cols-7"] button');
            dayButtons.forEach(button => {
                button.addEventListener('click', function() {
                    dayButtons.forEach(btn => btn.classList.remove('day-active'));
                    this.classList.add('day-active');
                    // Here you would load the workout for the selected day
                });
            });
            
            // Demo video functionality
            const demoButtons = document.querySelectorAll('.exercise-card button');
            demoButtons.forEach(button => {
                button.addEventListener('click', function() {
                    const exerciseName = this.closest('.exercise-card').querySelector('h4').textContent;
                    document.querySelector('#workout-video img').alt = `Detailed demonstration of ${exerciseName} showing proper form and technique`;
                    // Here you would load the appropriate video
                });
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>

```

    <script>
        // JS for interactive elements would go here
        function showExerciseDemo(button) {
            try {
                const exercise = button.closest('.exercise-card').querySelector('h4').textContent;
                document.getElementById('workout-video').querySelector('img').alt = `${exercise} demonstration`;
                alert(`Loading demo for: ${exercise}`);
            } catch (e) {
                console.error('Demo error:', e);
            }
        }

        document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
            // Tab functionality for workout days
            const dayButtons = document.querySelectorAll('[class*="grid-cols-7"] button');
            dayButtons.forEach(button => {
                button.addEventListener('click', function() {
                    dayButtons.forEach(btn => btn.classList.remove('day-active'));
                    this.classList.add('day-active');
                    // Here you would load the workout for the selected day
                });
            });
            
            // Demo video functionality
            const demoButtons = document.querySelectorAll('.exercise-card button');
            demoButtons.forEach(button => {
                button.addEventListener('click', function() {
                    const exerciseName = this.closest('.exercise-card').querySelector('h4').textContent;
                    document.querySelector('#workout-video img').alt = `Detailed demonstration of ${exerciseName} showing proper form and technique`;
                    // Here you would load the appropriate video
                });
            });
        });
    </script>
</body>
</html>
